qa_candidates.question: What are the mailbox limits and pricing for adding extra mailboxes to my business plan?
qa_candidates.answer: Hey! For business plan users, there’s a fair usage policy that covers up to 1000 mailboxes. If you need more than that, you can add extra slots—each extra 1000 mailboxes costs $50 a month. So, if you want 2000 more mailboxes, it’d be $100 a month. The pricing’s pretty straightforward, and our support team can help set everything up and update your billing with your saved payment method. Let us know if you want to expand!

qa_candidates.question: How should I ramp up sending emails from newly warmed Google accounts to ensure good deliverability?
qa_candidates.answer: When you start sending emails from new Google accounts, it’s a good idea to keep it super low at first—like just 1 to 3 emails a day for the first week. After that, you can slowly bump it up to about 5 to 8 emails per day per account. For the warmup process, try to stick to around 10 warmup emails a day, and maybe mix up the number a bit so it looks more natural. Once your first week’s done, you can turn on automatic ramp-up in your inbox settings so your sending volume goes up safely.

qa_candidates.question: How can I bulk assign email accounts to a campaign instead of selecting them one by one?
qa_candidates.answer: First, just create a tag and add the inboxes you want to it. After that, you can use that tag to add or remove all those inboxes from the campaign at once. You’ll find tags in your workspace settings under Tag Manager.

qa_candidates.question: If I change the 'Send to Risky' setting after some leads have already been skipped, how can I resend emails to those skipped leads?
qa_candidates.answer: If some leads got skipped before because of the old 'Send to Risky' setting, they won't get emails automatically now. If you want to reach out to those skipped leads again, you can either put them in a new duplicate campaign and send the emails, or just delete and re-upload them to the same campaign. Either way works and will let you contact them with the new setting.

qa_candidates.answer: The business plan gives you some extra warmup features, like linking email chains to a certain industry, setting a warmup schedule that fits when you usually send emails, skipping weekends, picking how often you want replies, and warming up your custom tracking domain and email signatures. You won’t get these options with the personal plan.

qa_candidates.question: How does the blacklist feature work? If a domain or email is added to the blacklist, will emails still be sent to them in future campaigns?
qa_candidates.answer: As soon as you add an email address or domain to the blacklist, our system will stop sending them any emails—even if you include them in future campaigns. The system just skips blacklisted addresses automatically, so you don’t have to worry about taking them off your lists yourself.

qa_candidates.question: How do I add multiple Gmail or Google Workspace email accounts from the same domain to Plusvibe (formerly pipl.ai)?
qa_candidates.answer: To add more than one Gmail or Google Workspace account from the same domain to Plusvibe, you'll first need to finish the app connection (OAuth) for your domain in Google Workspace and give it the right permissions. Once that's done, just connect each email account one at a time in Plusvibe by hitting the 'Add new account' button and signing in with the Gmail account you want. Make sure you're logged out of any previous Gmail sessions before you add a new one—this helps you avoid any weird login loops. Just repeat these steps for every user email you want to connect from that domain.

qa_candidates.question: If I import a list of leads that includes contacts already imported into an active campaign, will the system create duplicate leads?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, the system won’t create duplicate leads in the same campaign. If you upload a list with leads that are already in the campaign (like if they have the same email), those duplicates will just be skipped and won’t get imported again.

qa_candidates.question: Where can I adjust the email delivery interval settings for my campaign?
qa_candidates.answer: You set the delivery interval for each inbox separately—it’s not a campaign-wide or general setting. If you want to change how often emails go out, just head to the settings for each inbox you’re using with your campaign and adjust the delivery interval there.

qa_candidates.question: How does A/B testing work on Pipl, and can I split the test by a specific percentage or automatically send the winning variation to the remaining recipients?
qa_candidates.answer: With Pipl, when you start an A/B test, the system splits your sending volume 50/50 between your variations. You can keep an eye on how each one’s doing in the campaign stats and turn them on or off yourself whenever you want. Right now, there’s no way to set a custom split or have the system automatically send the winner to the rest of your list. You’ll find all the A/B testing options in the sequence editor.

qa_candidates.question: How can I create and use my own reply templates in the AI Replier?
qa_candidates.answer: If you want to make your own reply templates in the AI Replier, just use the 'Save as reply snippet' option down in the bottom right corner. After you write a reply you want to use again, click 'Save as reply snippet' to save it. Later, you can pick from your saved snippets whenever you’re replying. Just a heads up—it's called a 'snippet' in the interface, not a 'template'.

qa_candidates.question: Why does a lead show as 'Skipped: No MX record found for lead' during email validation?
qa_candidates.answer: Hey! That lead shows up as 'Skipped: No MX record found for lead' because the email address doesn’t have a valid MX (Mail Exchange) record. Basically, the domain isn’t set up to get emails, so our system can’t check the address or send anything to it.

qa_candidates.question: Will deleting a lead list affect my running email campaigns?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, deleting a lead list won’t mess up your running campaigns. Just a heads up though—if you delete leads straight from a campaign, you won’t be able to see replies, stats, or other info for those leads anymore.

qa_candidates.question: What happens to my connected email accounts in Pipl.ai if I cancel my subscription? Will they be deleted or just become inactive?
qa_candidates.answer: If you cancel your Pipl.ai subscription, your connected email accounts will just go inactive—they won't get deleted from our system. As long as you don't change the login info for those accounts, you can bring them back by subscribing again later, and you won't have to reconnect them. Just a heads up, though: you'll still need to keep paying your email provider to keep access to those accounts.

qa_candidates.question: Why is my email formatting, such as bold text, not appearing in test emails sent from my campaign?
qa_candidates.answer: If your emails aren’t showing bold text or other formatting, it’s probably because plain text sending is turned on. Plain text doesn’t support stuff like bold, italics, or colors. To use formatting, just turn off plain text and switch to HTML or rich text mode instead.

qa_candidates.question: What is the recommended practice for pausing cold email sending to improve email reputation, and how long should I pause sending to help recover from spam issues?
qa_candidates.answer: It’s pretty common to hit pause on all cold email sending for a bit and just let your email accounts focus on warming up. This gives your domain and sender reputation a chance to recover, especially if you think your emails might be landing in spam. Usually, taking a break for about 14 days works well, but you can stretch it to 30 days if you want to be extra careful. While you’re on this break, just keep your accounts in the warmup phase and hold off on sending any cold emails.
similar_questions: How can I recover email deliverability after transitioning mailboxes to a new provider without sufficient warm-up?

qa_candidates.question: Does your system automatically randomize email sending times, or do I need to set them manually?
qa_candidates.answer: Our system uses built-in AI to figure out the best time to send emails, so you don’t have to worry about picking a time yourself. Even if you set something like a 5-minute interval, it’ll still handle the timing automatically for you.

qa_candidates.question: If I leave the subject field empty when adding a follow-up step, will the same subject line be used as the previous email?
qa_candidates.answer: Yep, if you leave the subject blank for a follow-up, it'll just use the same subject as the last email. That way, all your emails stay together in the same thread in their inbox.

qa_candidates.question: Can I adjust or add custom fields to leads in a campaign after it has started, and how do I do this?
qa_candidates.answer: Yep, you can still change or add custom fields to leads in a campaign after it’s already started. Just re-upload your leads file with the new or updated fields, and pick the option to ‘replace existing lead data in this campaign.’ That’ll update your current leads with the changes.

qa_candidates.question: How can I schedule the first email in a sequence to be sent at a future date instead of immediately?
qa_candidates.answer: You can set your campaign to start later by heading to the schedule section when you’re making your sequence. Just look for the option to pick a start date—that’s when your first email will go out.

qa_candidates.answer: Only users on the business plan can make an API key.

qa_candidates.question: How accurate are warmup tools like 'Warmup Saved from Spam' for measuring email deliverability and spam rates?
qa_candidates.answer: Tools like 'Warmup Saved from Spam' are pretty handy for checking how healthy your email account is. If your warmup score is over 90%, that usually means your setup is solid and your domain or IP isn’t blacklisted. Just keep in mind, though, these tools can’t promise your actual campaign emails will always land in inboxes. That’s because warmup emails get sent in a controlled group with unique content, but campaign emails usually go out in bulk and look pretty similar, which spam filters notice. So, while warmup scores are great for keeping an eye on your technical health, they don’t always show what’ll happen with your real campaigns.
similar_questions: Why do email warmup tools like Pipl show better inbox placement results compared to online spam checkers, and does this mean my real campaign emails will avoid spam folders?

qa_candidates.question: If I receive bonus enrichment credits from a promotion or review, will my total credits reset to the standard monthly amount or will the bonus credits carry over to the next month?
qa_candidates.answer: Bonus enrichment credits (like the ones you get from promos or reviews) won't roll over to the next month—they'll reset to your usual monthly amount when your new billing cycle starts. But if you can't use your bonus credits before your billing date, just let us know and you can ask to have them added back for the next month.

qa_candidates.question: Where can I view replies from my email campaigns?
qa_candidates.answer: You can check out replies from your email campaigns in your Unified Inbox. Any replies to your campaign emails will get forwarded there, so they're easy to find.

qa_candidates.question: If fallback sending is enabled in a campaign, will prospects be skipped when switching accounts?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, if you’ve got fallback sending turned on for your campaign, your prospects won’t get skipped when you switch accounts. The fallback just makes sure your messages still go out if there’s a problem with your main sending account.

qa_candidates.answer: Yep, there’s a built-in Slack integration that’ll send email replies as notifications right to your Slack channel. You can set it up straight from your workspace settings, no need for anything extra like Zapier.

qa_candidates.question: Why was my Gsuite email account suspended even though I followed sending limits and my emails were not marked as spam?
qa_candidates.answer: Sometimes Gsuite email accounts get suspended out of the blue, even if you’re following all the sending limits and your emails aren’t marked as spam. Usually, this doesn’t mess with your email deliverability. You can usually fix it by just un-suspending your inbox in the Gsuite (Google Workspace) admin panel.

qa_candidates.question: Can I use Pipl webhooks to detect test emails or simulate webhook events without sending live campaigns?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, Pipl webhooks can’t pick up test emails or fake events. If you want to test your webhook setup, you’ll need to actually create and send a live campaign. Right now, there’s no built-in way to trigger webhook events without using real data.
similar_questions: Can I send a webhook after an email has been sent in Pipl, and include the entire email body in the webhook payload? Is there a variable for the email body sent?

qa_candidates.question: If I use the bulk edit feature to change email sending limits, will it affect other settings like warm-up if I don't modify them?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, using the bulk edit feature will only change the fields you actually update. Anything else, like warm-up settings, won’t be touched unless you change them yourself.
similar_questions: How can I manage warmup and campaign sending limits in Pipl, and what are best practices for setting these limits?

qa_candidates.question: Can I add attachments to my email replies?
qa_candidates.answer: Yep, you can add attachments to your email replies. Just look for the button in the reply box that lets you attach files.
similar_questions: How can I insert an image into my email if the original image URL does not allow embedding?

qa_candidates.question: What is the purpose of the OpenAI API key settings, and what features require it?
qa_candidates.answer: With the OpenAI API key settings, you can use your own OpenAI API key for things like AI enrichment (like when you’re enriching lists of leads). If you use your own key, you won’t use up any enrichment credits. Just so you know, other AI stuff like making campaign content, auto spintax, and the AI reply agent are all included with your subscription, so you don’t need to add an OpenAI API key for those.
qa_candidates.topic: AI features and OpenAI API integration

qa_candidates.question: Will my email campaigns and warmup processes continue to run if I shut down my computer, since your platform is cloud-based?
qa_candidates.answer: Yep, our platform is cloud-based, so your email campaigns and warmup stuff will keep running even if you turn off your computer. Everything works on our end, so you don’t have to leave your device on for your scheduled tasks to go through.

qa_candidates.question: Why are there no events available in Zapier when connecting Plusvibe (or Pipl), and how can I set up a trigger?
qa_candidates.answer: If you’re trying to connect Plusvibe or Pipl to Zapier and don’t see any events to pick from, it’s because these apps don’t have built-in triggers on Zapier. But no worries—you can still get things working using webhooks! Just set up a webhook in your Pipl (or Plusvibe) account to send data over to a Zapier Webhooks URL. Then in your Zap, pick the ‘Webhooks by Zapier’ trigger to catch and use that data. This way, you can still automate stuff even if the app doesn’t have its own Zapier triggers.

qa_candidates.question: How is your inbox service different from other premium inbox providers, and does it offer the same deliverability as setting up Google Workspace independently?
qa_candidates.answer:
Hey! Our inbox service is a bit different from most premium inbox providers because of how we keep everything separate. You’ll get your own Google Workspace admin panel, so your setup is totally isolated from anyone else’s. That way, what other users do won’t mess with your deliverability.

A lot of other providers put lots of clients under the same admin panel, which can end up hurting deliverability over time. With us, you actually own your domain, inbox, and setup—we just take care of all the technical stuff for you (like SPF, DKIM, DMARC, warm-up, and DNS) to make sure your cold emails perform as well as possible.

qa_candidates.question: How can I include an automatic unsubscribe link in my email campaigns, and why doesn't it appear in the email preview or merge fields dropdown?
qa_candidates.answer: If you want to add an automatic unsubscribe link to your email campaigns, just turn on the unsubscribe option in your campaign’s safety settings. Once that's on, the unsubscribe link will get added to every email you send with that campaign. Just a heads up—the unsubscribe link might not show up in your merge fields dropdown or in the email draft preview, since it only gets added when the emails actually go out to recipients.

qa_candidates.question: If I forward an email before responding, will the recipient see the forwarded email when I reply?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, if you’re using Unibox, any forwarded email won’t show up in your reply. You can go ahead and respond to the lead—they won’t see the forwarded email.

qa_candidates.question: Does the 'Stop Sending to Same Domain on Reply' feature apply to public domains like Gmail?
qa_candidates.answer: Nope, the 'Stop Sending to Same Domain on Reply' feature doesn’t work with public domains like Gmail or Mweb. It only works with private or custom domains.

qa_candidates.question: How can I enable two-factor authentication on my account?
qa_candidates.answer: Right now, we don’t have two-factor authentication for accounts.

qa_candidates.question: Can I pay with my PayPal account?
qa_candidates.answer: Hey! Right now, we can only take payments through Stripe.

qa_candidates.question: If I upgrade my Pipl.ai plan from Personal to Business, will I only be charged the difference between the two plans, and will my renewal date stay the same?
qa_candidates.answer: Yep, when you upgrade your Pipl.ai plan from Personal to Business, you’ll usually just pay the difference between the two plans, and your renewal date stays the same. That’s how it normally works when you upgrade.

qa_candidates.question: What is the reply rate for basic warm-up, and can using the same warm-up filter tag hurt deliverability?
qa_candidates.answer: The reply rate for basic warm-up is 35%. It’s better not to use the same warm-up filter tag in a bunch of emails, since that can make email providers flag you. To keep your deliverability up, try to mix up your filter tags and email content as much as you can.

qa_candidates.question: How can I edit or cancel a message that is scheduled to be sent in the future in Unibox?
qa_candidates.answer: Right now, you can only cancel a scheduled send in Unibox—you can't edit a scheduled message just yet. But don't worry, the option to edit scheduled messages is on the way in a future update!

qa_candidates.question: If I delete a lead, will it still be counted in my statistics and will it disappear from my inbox?
qa_candidates.answer: If you delete a lead, it’ll still show up in your stats and won’t disappear from your inbox.

qa_candidates.question: If I import a CSV file with a list of leads, in what order are the emails sent to them?
qa_candidates.answer: When you upload a CSV with your leads, the system will reach out to them in the same order they’re listed in your file, starting from the top. So if you want the emails to go out in a certain order, just rearrange your leads in the CSV before you import it.

qa_candidates.question: Can your email sending software integrate with clay.com?
qa_candidates.answer: We don’t have a direct integration with clay.com right now, but you can still connect things using some workarounds. Here’s a video that shows you how: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9KtD2Wrp2hU.

qa_candidates.question: Why am I seeing a message that an app is blocked from accessing my Google Account, and how can I resolve this when connecting to Google Workspace?
qa_candidates.answer: This message pops up because Google’s blocking the app from getting into some sensitive info in your Google Account, just to keep things secure. Don’t worry—your Google account isn’t blocked. To fix this, you’ll need to let the app through in your Google Admin panel. Usually, an admin has to whitelist the app or give it permission by following some steps in the Google Admin console. If you’re not sure how to do this, you can check out some how-to videos or guides from the app or from Google support.

qa_candidates.question: How can I access invoices if I am not the account owner?
qa_candidates.answer: Only the account owner can see invoices right now. There isn’t a way to let other users access them directly. If you need to see an invoice, you’ll have to ask the account owner to either share their access with you or send you the invoices themselves.
